definition: a series of yarns extended lengthwise in a loom and crossed by the weft

examples: the warp of the economic structure is agriculture

definition: a rope for warping or mooring a ship or boat
a twist or curve that has developed in something originally flat or straight
examples: a warp in a door panel

definition: to arrange (yarns) so as to form a warp
to turn or twist out of or as if out of shape, to twist or bend out of a plane
to cause to judge, choose, or act wrongly or abnormally : pervert

examples: intellect and learning … warped by prejudices

definition: to move (something, such as a ship) by hauling on a line attached to a fixed object
to move a ship by warping
